Speech Yves Mersch: Capital Markets Union - Optimising investment and financing conditions, increasing resilience http://t.co/g6f5zaTlv1
Mersch: Confident that CMU will achieve its core aim of enhancing financing for growth and fostering private risk-sharing
Mersch: National taxation often provides for a preferential treatment for debt – as opposed to equity financing
Mersch: Excessive reliance on debt instruments can amplify shocks. By contrast, greater reliance on equity could contribute to fin.stability
Mersch: Removing obstacles to cross-border capital markets will allow for more level playing field and for competitive capital markets
Mersch: Solvency requirements weigh on institutional investors and create undue negative incentives to long-term investment and risk-taking
Mersch: Full harmonisation is by no means a prerequisite for CMU to be successful
Mersch: By separating infrastructure from service, TARGET2Securities will foster competition between what are currently national monopolies
Mersch: CMU will not only foster competition among investors or borrowers, it can also foster competition among financial centres themselves

Draghi: A strong agreement for Greece means strong in design and implementation
Draghi: All our energy should focus on finding a strong agreement with Greece
Draghi: Like any other economy, Greek economy is viable if right policies are undertaken
Draghi: If needed, we can reconsider size, timing and design of our measures but currently not needed
Draghi: Reform programmes have been agreed but some implemented only partly
Draghi: Structural unemployment was already high before the crisis
Draghi: Monetary policy addresses the cyclical component of the weakness in the economy, not the structural
Draghi: Clear that some regulatory provisions make insurers' task of diversifying exposures more difficult
Draghi: Financial stability risks should be addressed with the proper macroprudential tools
Draghi: We don't plan to change our monetary policy stance. We will keep our course steady and if necessary add to it
Draghi: A disbursement would be a reason to consider the limit for Greek t-bills
Draghi: We are reviewing our rules as regards speaking engagements
Draghi: Governing Council wants Greece to stay in the euro area but there needs to be a strong agreement
Draghi: Fiscal policies should support the economic recovery while remaining in compliance with the Stability and Growth Pact
Draghi: Given high unemployment and low potential growth, the cyclical recovery should be supported by effective structural policies
